argument.name: tablename
argument.description: The name of the table to receive the new field(s); starting with a letter (A-Z or a-z) and composed of letters, numbers (0-9), and underscore (_) characters.

argument.name: new_field_list
argument.description: A CR-LF delimited list of one or more field entries. Each entry has the same format as when adding a new field through the Restructure Table dialog box. The format for each field entry as is as follows: Field_Name as C, Field_Type as C [, Width as N [, Decimals as N ]]. One of the following values:

page.description: Adds fields to a table. New_fields is a crlf list of fields to be added in format: fieldname,type,size,decimals
page.discussion:
The A5_ADD_FIELDS_TO_TABLE() function adds field(s) to an existing table.
Limitations: Desktop applications only
page.example: dim tbl as P tbl = table.open("product") ? tbl.fields_get() = 7.000000 a5_add_fields_to_table("product", "junk,C,0") ? tbl.fields_get() = 8.000000
